climbs.name: Tuktoolong
climbs.fa: Jesse Harvery, Cameron Burns, Mike Baker, Dec. 1997

content.description: 5.7, A1, and 80 feet of climbing;...sound like an easy summit to tick?  Guess again.  We found this climb to NOT be an easy tick. We couldn't find an easy way to get to this tower, and it took a long time to get to the base, because we had to rope up, lead a 5.10 crack section, etc...and we still hadn't even reached the BASE of the climb! The first part of the climb is , yeah,...5.7.....with protection being pitons hammered into mud.  Then you get to this bolt ladder section of pitons hammered into drilled holes;...only the holes weren't drilled deep enough , and the pitons are sticking WAY out;...it was sort of scary. Anyways;...we finally got to the summit, and survived this climb. Even though this climb has it's "issues"...we still had a fun adventure, and were glad we did it.  I believe Eric Kohl and Beth Shilliday did another route on this spire; probably on the opposite side....I think it's a bit harder than this one...
content.protection: Cams small to large, maybe 10 pins ( LA's to angles)9, some tie-offs.
content.location: Located just under the Kingfisher.  It's the small spire that looks like a hammer.
